channel.title: Rap Sucks?!?! THINK AGAIN -check-
channel.description:
I'm saying your probly listening to mainstream, I've got a list of MC's that will blow your mind, and actually make's rap more of a art. Then "tigglebiddies, badunkadunks, glocks, and bitches" here they are I reccomend each 100%.
Cunninlynguists - lynguistics or seanons are good, but all there tracks are hot Army of the Pharoahs - any of it is good 7L - rise of the rebel 7L & Esoteric - play dumb Jedi Mind Tricks - I Agaisnt I, animal rap, shit all of this is good Mr Lif - any of it's pretty swell The Last Emperor - he rules People Under the Stairs - Los Angeles Daze Dialated Peoples - This Way Aesop Rock - Daylight Nappy Roots - AwNaw MF Doom Immortal Technique
thats all i can think of right now off the top of my head, i'll add more. and give me your feedback alot of these groups are really good.

item.description:
@Mack_Master_J_Squeez wrote:

well my songs are

Ils - No Soul <------ Drum And Bass
Hive - Ultrasonic Sound <----- metal + Drum And Bass
Bon Jovi - Living on a Prayer <------ Rock
Arctic Monkeys - When The Sun Goes Down <----- Rock (kinda)
Desmond Child - Last of an Ancient Breed <------ Rock
Lil Scrappy - No Problems <------- Normal Rap
Eskimo Joe - Black Fingernails, Red Wine <---- Rock (kinda)
Felix Da Housecat - SilverScreen <----- Drum And Bass
Fort Minor - Petrified <----- Rap
Eskimo Joe - From The Sea <----- Donno
Franz Ferdinand - The Fallen <------- Rock
Loverboy - Working For The Weekend <------- Rock
Slow Down by Morcheeba <------ Slow Drum and Bass

item.title: Rap Sucks?!?! THINK AGAIN -check-
item.dc:creator: @kurt pixels
item.description:
@kurt wrote:

[quote=“philodespotos, post:4, topic:5123”]Addendum: Sage Francis, Eyedea, Blackalicious, Atmosphere, Buck65, Pedestrian, Dose One (never releases solo albums: he’s on a number of collaborations, though), Nonprophets (Sage Francis + Joe Beats), Sixtoo, KRS, Lyrics Born, Saul Williams, Alias, Sole, Del{tron3030, tha Funky Homosapien}, Themselves, Josh Martinez, Jurassic 5, EB&Rakim, MC Paul Barman, Murs&Slug on the two felt albums…

Dude, smooth. We should make a guide on good underground rap music…
The list goes on for ages. There are thousands of indy artists (not just hiphop, they fit into innumerable categories) that are incomprehensibly better than anything getting airplay today. It’s like this for most genres.

While I commend your taste, and highly recommend everything I listed above, it doesn’t sway anyone who’s already decided that rap sucks. The standard arguments of “drum machines take no talent,” “it’s just talking quickly,” “it’s all about bling&bitches” may not actually apply to the majority of hiphop, but that’s all they hear, that’s all they know, and they’re set in their ways. Just be happy that you know better, like the rest of us heads who have long since given up on explaining to people why 50 cent has nothing at all to do with hiphop. No need to try and convert people.

Seriously, check my list. It’s all delicious.

“The bling-bling era was cute, but it’s about to be done.” – Immortal Technique[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Rap Sucks?!?! THINK AGAIN -check-
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

A wonderful mix which is widely available online is Poetry is For Fairies. Primarily artists from the Anticon/Mush/Rhymesayers labels. Be sure to pick up both Side A and Side B.

Track listing for the curious:
[pre]
side a:
josh martinez - made in china - outlook
sole - bottle of humans - year of the $exxx $ymbol
eyedea - pushing buttons
sage francis - still sick… urine trouble - whore monger’s sing along
clouddead - clouddead - i promise never to get paint on my glasses again (1)
buck65 - anticon: music for the advancement of hip-hop - untitled
dose/pedestrian - rope ladder 12 - dead beats, generation of
deep puddle dynamics - taste of rain… why kneel - june 26th, 1998
themselves - them - it’s them
why? - anticon label sampler - hahaha/on my 19th
sole - bottle of humans - our dirty big secret
molemen [buck65/sixtoo] - family values - games
sole - bottle of humans - suicide song
sage francis - still sick… urine trouble - mullet (live at the met cafe)

side b:
boombip&doseone - circle - questions over coffee
buck65 - man overboard - sunday driver (track 6)
sage/sixtoo/sole - sick of waiting tables - testimony
e&a - first born - murder of memories
deep puddle dynamics - taste of rain… why kneel - deep puddle theme
reaching quiet - rope ladder 12 - 113th clean
aesrock/slug - float - i’ll be ok
[113th clean again]
saul williams - amethyst rock star - penny for a thought
atmosphere - lucy ford - woman with the tattooed hands
sole - bottle of humans - bottle of humans
[a track, with sole, but i don’t know what]
themselves - them - eating homework
sole - [another unknown; can’t find anywhere]
alias - the other side of the looking glass - final act
atmosphere - lucy ford - party for the fight to write
[/pre]

Whatever you think about leeching music, if you like these artists, please, buy their albums. Many of these people have barely gotten past working day jobs and doing music on the side.

Support independent artists, and support independent labels.

Read full topic

item.title: Rap Sucks?!?! THINK AGAIN -check-
item.dc:creator: @philodespotos philodespotos
item.description:
@philodespotos wrote:

Addendum: Sage Francis, Eyedea, Blackalicious, Atmosphere, Buck65, Pedestrian, Dose One (never releases solo albums: he’s on a number of collaborations, though), Nonprophets (Sage Francis + Joe Beats), Sixtoo, KRS, Lyrics Born, Saul Williams, Alias, Sole, Del{tron3030, tha Funky Homosapien}, Themselves, Josh Martinez, Jurassic 5, EB&Rakim, MC Paul Barman, Murs&Slug on the two felt albums…

The list goes on for ages. There are thousands of indy artists (not just hiphop, they fit into innumerable categories) that are incomprehensibly better than anything getting airplay today. It’s like this for most genres.

While I commend your taste, and highly recommend everything I listed above, it doesn’t sway anyone who’s already decided that rap sucks. The standard arguments of “drum machines take no talent,” “it’s just talking quickly,” “it’s all about bling&bitches” may not actually apply to the majority of hiphop, but that’s all they hear, that’s all they know, and they’re set in their ways. Just be happy that you know better, like the rest of us heads who have long since given up on explaining to people why 50 cent has nothing at all to do with hiphop. No need to try and convert people.

Seriously, check my list. It’s all delicious.

“The bling-bling era was cute, but it’s about to be done.” – Immortal Technique

Read full topic
